name: Greedy Best-First Search
description: Expands the node that appears closest to goal by heuristic alone. Fast but not optimal.
when_to_use: When speed matters more than optimality
Real-time pathfinding where quick response is needed
Heuristic is highly accurate and near-optimal paths are acceptable
Very large search spaces where A* is too slow
when_not_to_use: When optimal path is required (use A* instead)
When heuristic is poor or misleading
Safety-critical applications requiring guaranteed optimal solutions

complexity.time: O(b^m) worst case, often much better with good heuristic

parameters.name: goal_test
parameters.description: Returns true if state is the goal

use_cases: Quick exploratory search in large spaces
embedding_text: Greedy best-first search expands node closest to goal by heuristic alone. Fast but not optimal. Use when speed matters more than finding the cheapest path. Good for real-time pathfinding in large spaces.
